snippet: But promising treatments to fight advanced melanoma with immunotherapy — drugs that use the body’s immune system — also had severe side effects in studies.
abstract: Researchers at American Society of Clinical Oncology conference say that drugs that unleash the body's immune system to combat tumors could allow patients with advanced melanoma to live far longer than ever before; note also that these promising treatments, called immunotherapy, had severe side effects in studies.
lead_paragraph: But promising treatments to fight advanced melanoma with immunotherapy — drugs that use the body’s immune system — also had severe side effects in studies.

headline.main: New System for Treating Cancer Seen as Hopeful
headline.print_headline: New System for Treating Cancer Seen as Hopeful
